prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Create Sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines: * Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) * Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.75) * Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.75) * Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Apply Scale and Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.45 units. Part 2 Instructions Create Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system (part\\_2 coordinate system) with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 180.0 and a translation vector of 0.0375, 0.7125, 0.0. Create Sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the part\\_2 coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines: * Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.675, 0.0) * Line 2: Start Point (0.675, 0.0), End Point (0.675, 0.675) * Line 3: Start Point (0.675, 0.675), End Point (0.0, 0.675) * Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.675), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Apply Scale and Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.675. 2. Extrude the sketch along the opposite direction of the normal direction by 0.42 units. Part 3 Instructions Create Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system (part\\_3 coordinate system) with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 180.0 and a translation vector of 0.1125, 0.6375, 0.0. Create Sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the part\\_3 coordinate system. 2. Draw a rectangle by creating four lines: * Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.525, 0.0) * Line 2: Start Point (0.525, 0.0), End Point (0.525, 0.525) * Line 3: Start Point (0.525, 0.525), End Point (0.0, 0.525) * Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.525), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Apply Scale and Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.525. 2. Extrude the sketch along the opposite direction of the normal direction by 0.045 units. Final Assembly Instructions With all the parts created, assemble them with the correct dimensions and geometry. 1. Place Part\\_1 at the origin of the assembly coordinate system with the flat top facing upward and align it with the X and Y axes. 2. Place Part\\_2 at a position (0.0375, 0.7125, 0.0) relative to Part\\_1, ensuring its flat top faces upward. 3. Place Part\\_3 at a position (0.1125, 0.6375, 0.0) relative to Part\\_1, ensuring its flat top faces upward. You will have a completed CAD assembly of the given JSON object, which is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and sloped sides.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Draw the 2D sketch on face_1: The sketch consists of a single face with a loop formed by six connected lines. - Line 1: [0.0, 0.3248], [0.1875, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.1875, 0.0], [0.5625, 0.0] - Line 3: [0.5625, 0.0], [0.75, 0.3248] - Line 4: [0.75, 0.3248], [0.5625, 0.6495] - Line 5: [0.5625, 0.6495], [0.1875, 0.6495] - Line 6: [0.1875, 0.6495], [0.0, 0.3248] Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale = 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.1565, Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0. Note that the sketch_scale is already applied in the previous step. **Part 2: Cylindrical object** Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top is slightly curved and the bottom is flat. The object has a series of concentric circles that create a pattern around its circumference. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2802, 0.23, 0.1565] Draw the 2D sketch on face_1: The sketch consists of a single face with a loop formed by one circle. - Circle: Center [0.0948, 0.0948], Radius: 0.0948 Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale = 0.1896. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.2802, 0.23, 0.1565). Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.1565, Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0. Note that the sketch_scale is already applied in the previous step. Combine part_1 and part_2 using the appropriate boolean operation: JoinFeatureOperation. The result is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The prism is positioned at a slight angle to the viewer.</description>
